com.gluonhq.charm.glisten.layout.layer

Class SnackbarPopupView

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
              • com.gluonhq.charm.glisten.layout.Layer
                • com.gluonhq.charm.glisten.layout.layer.SidePopupView
                  • com.gluonhq.charm.glisten.layout.layer.SnackbarPopupView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class SnackbarPopupView
extends SidePopupView

    The SnackbarPopupView class is used to show a message - it will scroll out from the bottom of the screen. Optionally, a Button can be displayed with a custom event handler.

    The control will be dismissed after 5 seconds, or if the user clicks in the action button, or either in the control or outside of it.

    MobileApplication already includes one instance of this control, that can be invoked with MobileApplication.showMessage(java.lang.String) or with MobileApplication.showMessage(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, javafx.event.EventHandler)

    Example

    The following example shows a SnackbarPopupView when the user presses the button with the label "Click". 

     public class MyApp extends MobileApplication {

   @Override
   public void init() {
     addViewFactory(HOME_VIEW, ()  -> {
       Button button = new Button("Click");
       button.setOnAction(e  -> showMessage("This is a Message!", "Action", t  -> System.out.println("Snackbar")));
       return new View(button) {
         @Override
         protected void updateAppBar(AppBar appBar) {
           appBar.setTitleText("SnackbarPopupView");
         }
       };
     });
   }
 }
    Since:
    1.0.0
